intro: Harmogia densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved harmogia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in rocky or coastal habitats due to its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. The plant's compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
